verses.text: \w Now|strong="H1961"\w* \w when|strong="H1961"\w* Hiram king \w of|strong="H3117"\w* Tyre heard \w that|strong="H3605"\w* \w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w* \w had|strong="H1961"\w* \w been|strong="H1961"\w* anointed king \w in|strong="H3117"\w* \w his|strong="H3605"\w* father’s \w place|strong="H1961"\w*, \w he|strong="H3117"\w* sent envoys \w to|strong="H5704"\w* \w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w*; \w for|strong="H5704"\w* Hiram \w had|strong="H1961"\w* \w always|strong="H3605"\w* \w been|strong="H1961"\w* \w a|strong="H3068"\w* friend \w of|strong="H3117"\w* \w David|strong="H3117"\w*.
\w And|strong="H3117"\w* \w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w* relayed \w this|strong="H3117"\w* message \w to|strong="H1961"\w* Hiram:

“As you \w are|strong="H1241"\w* well aware, due \w to|strong="H6242"\w* \w the|strong="H3967"\w* wars waged on all sides against my father David, \w he|strong="H1241"\w* could not build \w a|strong="H3068"\w* house \w for|strong="H1241"\w* \w the|strong="H3967"\w* Name \w of|strong="H6629"\w* \w the|strong="H3967"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w* his God until \w the|strong="H3967"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w* \w had|strong="H6629"\w* put his enemies under his feet.

\w But|strong="H3588"\w* \w now|strong="H1961"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w* \w my|strong="H3605"\w* God \w has|strong="H1961"\w* given \w me|strong="H1961"\w* \w rest|strong="H7965"\w* \w on|strong="H1961"\w* \w every|strong="H3605"\w* \w side|strong="H5676"\w*, \w and|strong="H4428"\w* \w there|strong="H1961"\w* \w is|strong="H1931"\w* \w no|strong="H3605"\w* adversary \w or|strong="H5704"\w* crisis.

\w So|strong="H3427"\w* behold, \w I|strong="H3117"\w* plan \w to|strong="H5704"\w* build \w a|strong="H3068"\w* house \w for|strong="H5704"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* Name \w of|strong="H3117"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w* \w my|strong="H3605"\w* God, according \w to|strong="H5704"\w* what \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w* said \w to|strong="H5704"\w* \w my|strong="H3605"\w* father \w David|strong="H3117"\w*: ‘\w I|strong="H3117"\w* \w will|strong="H3478"\w* put \w your|strong="H3605"\w* son \w on|strong="H3117"\w* \w your|strong="H3605"\w* throne \w in|strong="H3427"\w* \w your|strong="H3605"\w* \w place|strong="H8478"\w*, \w and|strong="H3063"\w* \w he|strong="H3117"\w* \w will|strong="H3478"\w* build \w the|strong="H3605"\w* house \w for|strong="H5704"\w* \w My|strong="H3605"\w* Name.’

\w Now|strong="H1961"\w* \w therefore|strong="H1961"\w*, order \w that|strong="H8010"\w* cedars \w of|strong="H8147"\w* Lebanon \w be|strong="H1961"\w* cut down \w for|strong="H1961"\w* \w me|strong="H1961"\w*. \w My|strong="H1961"\w* servants \w will|strong="H1961"\w* \w be|strong="H1961"\w* \w with|strong="H8147"\w* \w your|strong="H1961"\w* servants, \w and|strong="H5483"\w* \w I|strong="H1961"\w* \w will|strong="H1961"\w* pay \w your|strong="H1961"\w* servants whatever wages \w you|strong="H1961"\w* set, \w for|strong="H1961"\w* \w you|strong="H1961"\w* know \w that|strong="H8010"\w* \w there|strong="H1961"\w* \w are|strong="H5483"\w* none among \w us|strong="H1961"\w* \w as|strong="H1961"\w* skilled \w in|strong="H8010"\w* logging \w as|strong="H1961"\w* \w the|strong="H1961"\w* Sidonians.” Hiram’s Reply to Solomon (2 Chronicles 2:11–18)

When Hiram received \w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w*’s \w message|strong="H1697"\w*, \w he|strong="H3605"\w* rejoiced \w greatly|strong="H4428"\w* \w and|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H1697"\w*, “Blessed \w be|strong="H3808"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w* \w this|strong="H1697"\w* \w day|strong="H2320"\w*! \w He|strong="H3605"\w* \w has|strong="H4428"\w* given David \w a|strong="H3068"\w* wise son \w over|strong="H4428"\w* \w this|strong="H1697"\w* great \w people|strong="H3808"\w*!”

\w Then|strong="H1961"\w* Hiram sent \w a|strong="H3068"\w* reply \w to|strong="H1961"\w* Solomon, saying: “\w I|strong="H8033"\w* \w have|strong="H1961"\w* \w received|strong="H1961"\w* \w your|strong="H1961"\w* message; \w I|strong="H8033"\w* \w will|strong="H1961"\w* do all \w you|strong="H4725"\w* desire regarding \w the|strong="H1961"\w* cedar \w and|strong="H4941"\w* cypress \f + \fr 5:8 \ft Or pine or juniper or fir; also in verse 10\f* timber.

\w My|strong="H5414"\w* servants \w will|strong="H3820"\w* haul \w the|strong="H5921"\w* logs \w from|strong="H5921"\w* Lebanon \w to|strong="H5921"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w Sea|strong="H3220"\w*,\f + \fr 5:9 \ft That is, the Mediterranean Sea, also called the Great Sea\f* \w and|strong="H2451"\w* \w I|strong="H5414"\w* \w will|strong="H3820"\w* float \w them|strong="H5414"\w* \w as|strong="H5414"\w* rafts \w by|strong="H5921"\w* \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* \w to|strong="H5921"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w place|strong="H5414"\w* \w you|strong="H5414"\w* specify. There \w I|strong="H5414"\w* \w will|strong="H3820"\w* separate \w the|strong="H5921"\w* logs, \w and|strong="H2451"\w* \w you|strong="H5414"\w* can \w take|strong="H5414"\w* \w them|strong="H5414"\w* \w away|strong="H5414"\w*. \w And|strong="H2451"\w* \w in|strong="H5921"\w* \w exchange|strong="H5414"\w*, \w you|strong="H5414"\w* can meet \w my|strong="H5414"\w* needs \w by|strong="H5921"\w* providing \w my|strong="H5414"\w* household \w with|strong="H5921"\w* food.”

\w So|strong="H7235"\w* Hiram \w provided|strong="H7235"\w* \w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w* \w with|strong="H4714"\w* \w all|strong="H3605"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* cedar \w and|strong="H1121"\w* cypress timber \w he|strong="H3605"\w* wanted,

\w and|strong="H1121"\w* \w year|strong="H1121"\w* \w after|strong="H1961"\w* \w year|strong="H1121"\w* Solomon \w would|strong="H3605"\w* provide Hiram \w with|strong="H3605"\w* 20,000 cors \w of|strong="H1121"\w* wheat \f + \fr 5:11 \ft 20,000 cors is approximately 124,800 bushels or 4.4 million liters (probably about 3,800 tons or 3,400 metric tons of wheat).\f* \w as|strong="H1961"\w* food \w for|strong="H8034"\w* \w his|strong="H3605"\w* household, \w as|strong="H1961"\w* well \w as|strong="H1961"\w* 20,000 baths \w of|strong="H1121"\w* pure olive oil.\f + \fr 5:11 \ft LXX (see also 2 Chronicles 2:10); 20,000 baths is approximately 116,000 gallons or 440,000 liters of olive oil; Hebrew twenty cors of pure oil or twenty cors of pressed oil\f*

\w And|strong="H2568"\w* \w the|strong="H1961"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w* \w gave|strong="H1696"\w* Solomon wisdom, \w as|strong="H1961"\w* \w He|strong="H2568"\w* \w had|strong="H1961"\w* \w promised|strong="H1696"\w* \w him|strong="H1961"\w*. \w There|strong="H1961"\w* \w was|strong="H1961"\w* peace between Hiram \w and|strong="H2568"\w* Solomon, \w and|strong="H2568"\w* \w the|strong="H1961"\w* two \w of|strong="H7892"\w* \w them|strong="H1961"\w* \w made|strong="H1696"\w* \w a|strong="H3068"\w* treaty.\f + \fr 5:12 \ft Forms of the Hebrew berit are translated in most passages as covenant.\f* Solomon’s Labor Force

\w Then|strong="H1696"\w* \w King|strong="H5921"\w* Solomon conscripted \w a|strong="H3068"\w* labor force \w of|strong="H4480"\w* 30,000 men \w from|strong="H4480"\w* \w all|strong="H5704"\w* Israel.

\w He|strong="H3605"\w* sent \w them|strong="H8085"\w* \w to|strong="H8085"\w* Lebanon \w in|strong="H4428"\w* monthly shifts \w of|strong="H4428"\w* 10,000 \w men|strong="H5971"\w*, \w so|strong="H8085"\w* \w that|strong="H5971"\w* \w they|strong="H5971"\w* \w would|strong="H5971"\w* spend \w one|strong="H3605"\w* month \w in|strong="H4428"\w* Lebanon \w and|strong="H4428"\w* two months \w at|strong="H4428"\w* home. \w And|strong="H4428"\w* Adoniram \w was|strong="H4428"\w* \w in|strong="H4428"\w* charge \w of|strong="H4428"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* forced labor.
\w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w* \w had|strong="H1961"\w* 70,000 porters \w and|strong="H7971"\w* 80,000 stonecutters \w in|strong="H4428"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* mountains,
not including \w his|strong="H7971"\w* 3,300 \f + \fr 5:16 \ft Hebrew; some LXX manuscripts 3,600; see 2 Chronicles 2:18.\f* foremen who supervised \w the|strong="H7971"\w* workers.

\w And|strong="H3068"\w* \w the|strong="H6440"\w* \w king|strong="H6440"\w* commanded \w them|strong="H5414"\w* \w to|strong="H5704"\w* quarry \w large|strong="H1004"\w*, costly stones \w to|strong="H5704"\w* \w lay|strong="H5414"\w* \w the|strong="H6440"\w* foundation \w of|strong="H1004"\w* \w the|strong="H6440"\w* \w temple|strong="H1004"\w* \w with|strong="H1004"\w* dressed stones.

\w So|strong="H6258"\w* Solomon’s \w and|strong="H3068"\w* Hiram’s builders, along \w with|strong="H3068"\w* \w the|strong="H3068"\w* Gebalites, quarried \w the|strong="H3068"\w* stone \w and|strong="H3068"\w* prepared \w the|strong="H3068"\w* timber \w and|strong="H3068"\w* stone \w for|strong="H3068"\w* \w the|strong="H3068"\w* construction \w of|strong="H3068"\w* \w the|strong="H3068"\w* temple.
